Script started on 2022-10-11 19:04:43-04:00

1. To get the top 1000 reviewers within the dataset, I cut the second column, which contains user ids and sorted it numerically and in reverse. 
Then I used uniq to get a count of reviews for each individual and sorted once again using the first column containing the unique counts for each reviewer to 
get the highest reviewers at the top. Then, using head, I got the top 1000 reviewers, since I had got the top 1000 reviewers. 
]0;sohan@sjsu:~/amazon/amazonbooks[sohan@sjsu amazonbooks]$ cut -f2 amazon_reviews_us_Books_v1_02.tsv | sort -nr | uniq -c | sort -nr -k1 | head -1000 | awk '{print $2}' > top_thousand_reviewers.tsv

2. I used a for loop to iterate through the top_thousand_reviewers file generated from #1 above and used grep to get all the reviews for each
respective reviewer. The output was redirected to a file named after the respective reviewer's ID and placed within the CUSTOMERS directory.   
]0;sohan@sjsu:~/amazon/amazonbooks[sohan@sjsu amazonbooks]$ for i in `cat top_thousand_reviewers.tsv` ; do grep $i amazon_reviews_us_Books_v1_02.tsv > CUSTOMERS/$i.txt ; done

See below for ls output of CUSTOMERS directory:
